name: Chingri Malai Curry
description: A creamy and spicy curry made with prawns, coconut milk, and spices
steps: Heat oil in a pan and fry onions till golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and green chilli. Fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add prawns and fry till it turns pink. Take out the prawns and keep them aside.
Add turmeric, cumin, coriander, and garam masala. Fry for 2 minutes.
Add coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes. Add salt to taste.
Add prawns and cook for 2-3 minutes or until prawns are cooked through.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Shorshe Ilish
description: A spicy and tangy dish made with Hilsa fish and mustard paste
steps: Mix the mustard paste with turmeric, red chilli powder, salt and green chillies. Add a little water to make a thick paste.
Marinate the Hilsa fish with the paste for 30 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish on both sides till golden brown.
Take out the fish from the pan and keep aside.
Add the remaining mustard paste to the pan and fry for 2 minutes.
Add water to make the gravy and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the fried fish to the gravy and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Shrimp Curry (Chingri Malai Curry)
description: A classic Bangladeshi dish made with shrimp, coconut milk, and spices.
ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 green chili pepper, seeded and minced
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili pepper and sauté until softened.
Add turmeric, cumin, coriander, and garam masala and cook for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-5 minutes.
Stir in coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Beef Curry (Gosht Bhuna)
description: A hearty and flavorful Bangladeshi beef curry made with onions, tomatoes, and a variety of spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs. beef chuck, cut into cubes
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add onions, garlic, and ginger and sauté until softened.
Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and cayenne pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Add beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Add enough water to cover beef and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2 hours or until beef is tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.
